Documentation.content: Triangular matrix solver. op(A) X = alpha B or X op(A) = alpha B where op is Transpose, X and B is MxN
Documentation.return: the matrix of coefficients to get B.
Documentation.param: side side for A, Side.Ax is op(A) X = alpha B
tri Says whether A is Upper or Lower triangle
transposeA is op(A) the transpose of A
diag is the diagonal an implied unit diagonal or supplied
M number of rows
N number of columns
lda the leading dimension of the A matrix, either M or N
alpha the scalar multiplier for B
A a triangular matrix
B the matrix of values for the solve

Documentation.content: Compute LU Factorization of matrix A.
Documentation.return: composite matrix of factors, lower triangle has an implied diagonal of ones. Upper triangle has the diagonal of the composite.

n number of columns of A

Documentation.content: Internal function to determine values for the model co-efficients and selected stats from building the model.
Documentation.return: coefficient matrix plus model building stats
Documentation.param: independents the independent values
dependents the dependent values.
max_iter maximum number of iterations to try
epsilon the minimum change in the Beta value estimate to continue
ridge a value to populate a diagonal matrix that is added to a matrix help assure that the matrix is invertible.

Documentation.content: DPOTF2 computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A. The factorization has the form A = U**T * U , if UPLO = 'U', or A = L * L**T, if UPLO = 'L', where U is an upper triangular matrix and L is lower triangular. This is the unblocked version of the algorithm, calling Level 2 BLAS.
Documentation.param: tri indicate whether upper or lower triangle is used
r number of rows/columns in the square matrix
A the square matrix
clear clears the unused triangle

Documentation.content: Scale a vector alpha
Documentation.param: N number of elements in the vector
alpha the scaling factor
X the column major matrix holding the vector
incX the stride to get to the next element in the vector
skipped the number of elements skipped to get to the first element

Documentation.content: Implements symmetric rank update C <- alpha A**T A + beta C or c <- alpha A A**T + beta C. C is N x N.
Documentation.param: tri update upper or lower triangle
transposeA Transpose the A matrix to be NxK
N number of rows
K number of columns in the update matrix or transpose
alpha the alpha scalar
A the update matrix, either NxK or KxN
beta the beta scalar
C the matrix to update
clear clear the triangle that is not updated. BLAS assumes that symmetric matrices have only one of the triangles and this option lets you make that true.

B the matrix of values for the solve
